metadata.title: CVE-2014-8547 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
libavcodec/gifdec.c in FFmpeg before 2.4.2 does not properly compute imageheights, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds access) or possibly have unspecified other impact viacrafted GIF data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8547` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.5.4-1
libav-tools - 7:2.5.4-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.5.4-1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.5.4-1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.5.4-1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.5.4-1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.5.4-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.5.4-1').
